Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the fact that "nobody below a million dollars a year paid anything" when the federal income tax was first created.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide specific evidence or data to back up the assertion.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the statement about the federal income tax only applies to the 1913 tax system, without considering other historical periods or tax systems.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations or interpretations for the claim, such as the consideration of exemptions and the definition of "millionaire" in different time periods.
